comment.body:
> [caryoscelus](#comment_1_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE): ...[more silence]

wow i have readers o.o
ahh nice way to find random sites i guess

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): If anyone interested to know what the "--multiuser_local" parameter mean/why is important, here it is explained.
> And here is similar tutorial for the completness: Using the Multiuser plugin

took me forever, as i painstakingly reverse engineer the source code due to lack of docs, hopefully others dont have to do the same

> [piloth](#comment_2_1FKuNsExQML7APuNmkCV8uzB5pKupcmnck): I have a question... does anyone know what the StemPort plugin is?

Nope, no clue tbh seems to do smth with tor and port and "stem" based off a rough read of the source code which i dont even understand of most things
Possibly some onion controller?

> [piloth](#comment_3_1FKuNsExQML7APuNmkCV8uzB5pKupcmnck): Possibly. I'm not sure. I was just looking through the plugins directory and I know the ones that have 'disabled' in the folder name aren't turned on or being used. Was just curious. Thanks for taking the time to answer :)

same here np

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_3_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Hi, some people post large data on sites like ZeroUp or their own blogs and link their articles/data from ZeroTalk (create new ZeroTalk topic to attract attention).Some times i created ZeroTalk topic just to mention link and a few keywords so people can find the post via ZeroHello search functionality.

so you recommend i should post onto zerotalk too?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_4_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I would find related topics on ZeroTalk using ZeroHello search feature "Search in connected sites" (example query: bandwidth speed site:zerotalk) and if not found, maybe compose new ZeroTalk topic where i shortly sumarize my thoughts and link to full articles discussions on UnlimitTalk or here.
> BTW: if you are reaching your limit on ZeroTalk, you will see contact e-mail of the nofish who can raise your limit. He did once for me and once without me asking.

i mean i reach it countless times there's thunderarchive and thunderarchive just made for that
what i am hoping is just someone else to do it because it really feels like i am just plugging ads all over

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_4_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I would find related topics on ZeroTalk using ZeroHello search feature "Search in connected sites" (example query: bandwidth speed site:zerotalk) and if not found, maybe compose new ZeroTalk topic where i shortly sumarize my thoughts and link to full articles discussions on UnlimitTalk or here.
> BTW: if you are reaching your limit on ZeroTalk, you will see contact e-mail of the nofish who can raise your limit. He did once for me and once without me asking.

Consider it done
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1530089964_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K/List+Of+My+Post+On+Unlimit+Talk

> [swastika](#comment_1_1b9urVTLtAAZAidg6hchWqhrVtYXUaoj7): Good post, though I think the result will be that controversial or unpopular speech will be downvoted and thus likely censored by the site, people will simply use the Trust functionality to mean I agree or I like.

while nothing stops you from allocating someone to -100 trust score(aka hiding them) who you share differing opinions, i would say it's your own willing choice to form a bubble and choose to not interact with people who dont share the same opinion

but if you try to abuse it by marking things you dont agree with as spam, that's why the moderation actions need full transparency, to allow you to call others out weed out the less trustable peers, the hidden post thing probably should be like how github does it
`[ 10 peers hides 5 post as spam  click to expand ]` expanding shows hidden post and people who vouch for hiding it

now i realize there's also need for a "flag this user as not trustable" might consider readapting negative trust scores into that so delegation takes it into account and creates a less abusable network if you trust the right people that blacklist people who abuses their powers

> [diligentslacker](#comment_1_1Mx5xcSVsv8mdsXtKwBPD8X1SEfzN2VR5u): If you're concern is bots and voter fraud... doesn't zeronet already handle this with blockchain? I mean assuming a user can only vote signed in. I'm not saying this couldn't have other uses like content aggregation.

no zeronet does not use blockchain it only uses bitcoin cryptography
bots can easily register hundreds of accounts in a quick succession if someone is motivated to make these bots to mass vote on something
there's nothing stopping them to spam or to maliciously vote for something

> [tusiko](#comment_1_1G2W1r5Eh1M81v8sUanDq2Cj4xnaRJurgs):Bad posts can be voted down and posts under 50 will not be shown to you. So you only see the good posts.

Personally i dont agree on "bad post" like what makes a post "bad", most times it's always used as a "i dont agree with you" button,
thus i just included things like matching a "flaggable content", example spam, nsfw etc which people are free to opt in/out of, both are separate things
but yeah you could have an "opinion voting" button which you only follow people you WOT trust, though i dont really think it's a good use of WOT
